item.title: CS2 Graduate Attributes
item.description:
Skills for Career Success

transferrable skills

  1. Communication
  2. Problem-solving
  3. Leadership
  4. Time management
  5. Organizational skills
  6. Adaptability
  7. Self-motivation
  8. Interpersonal skills
  9. Teamwork
  10. Critical thinking

21th Century Skills

  1. Critical thinking
  2. Problem solving
  3. Collaboration
  4. Adaptability
  5. Communication
  6. Creativity
  7. Leadership
  8. Digital literacy
  9. Emotional intelligence
  10. Cultural awareness

Graduate Attributes (GA)

Definition

Graduate Attributes are the skills, knowledge, values and attributes that students are expected to acquire during their studies.

Types

  1. Academic

  2. Personal

  3. Transferable

item.title: Literature Review
item.description:
介绍

定义

A published collection of written knowledge on or related to a particular subject.

分类

  1. Scholarly Articles

  2. Books

  3. Reports

要求

  1. Based on Existing Research

  2. Gaps in the literature

  3. Theory

  4. Where do you fit

技巧

连接词

开头

  • To begin with

中间(顺承)

  • In addition
  • Furthermore
  • Besides
  • What’s more
  • It was (found) that
  • … is also …

中间(转折)

  • but
  • However
  • still

中间(因果)

  • The aim was to
  • As a result
  • In this way

就…而言

  • In terms of
  • When it comes to
  • With regard to
  • In respect of
  • With reference to
  • As to
  • In relation to

结束语

  • Overall
  • Generally(Speaking)
  • All in all

形容词

好与坏

  1. 好
  • advantage
  • benefits
  • positive
  • useful characteristic of
  1. 坏
  • disadvantage
  • negative (aspect)
  • drawback

多

  • quite a lot
  • a large quantity (number) of
  • numerous
  • countless

重要

  • vital
  • significant
  • important
  • crucial
  • essential

几乎 大概

  • nearly
  • almost
  • nearly
  • about
  • around
  • roughly
  • approximately

原因与结果

  1. 原因
  • As
  • Result from
  • Since
  • Due to
  • On account of
  • owing to
  1. 结果
  • result in
  • consequently
  • Credit to
  • attribute to
  • lead to
  • bring about

动词

发光

  • illuminate
  • glow
  • lighten

摔 倒 掉

  • fall(down/into/to)

  • drop

能够 做得好

  • could/can
  • be able to
  • is capable to/of
  • do well in
  • be good at

增和降

  1. 增
  • increase
  • rise
  • ascent
  • lift
  • uprise
  • soar
  1. 降
  • decrease
  • drop
  • decline
  • lessen
  • diminish
  • reduce

损害

  • destory
  • damage
  • hurt
  • ruin
  • break
  • spoil

item.title: 单词(2023 2.25-3.3)
item.description:
2023 2.25

Once upon a time, in the kingdom of Meganeton, there lived a brave and untamed prince. He was determined to ascertain the truth behind a long-standing dispute between his kingdom and its neighboring kingdom.

The prince was a brilliant scientist and he decided to pursue the matter using the latest scientific methods. He built a solenoid, a device that uses an electric current to create a magnetic field, to measure the viability of the mass medium between the two kingdoms.

He also used a logie, a device that measures the speed of sound, to measure the resonant frequency of the mass medium. He then used an insulator and coaxial cable to protect the device from interference.

The prince was intrigued when his experiment revealed that the mass medium was anisotropic, meaning it had different properties in different directions. He suspected that this was the source of the dispute.

To further investigate, the prince used a retarder, a device that slows down the speed of sound, to see if the properties of the mass medium could be changed. He then used cellophane to cover the retarder and see if it changed the properties of the mass medium.

The prince was delighted to find that the cellophane had indeed changed the properties of the mass medium. He was finally able to ascertain the truth behind the long-standing dispute and bring peace between the two kingdoms.

2023 2.26

Once upon a time there lived a boorish prince who was always befuddling the courtiers with his austere attitude. He was so cajoling that no one could ever guess what he was thinking. He was known for his candor but his words were so sharp that they often left people exhausted.

One day, the prince decided to test the courtiers by giving them a difficult problem. He asked them to solve a combinatorial problem that involved partitioning a set of bolts into pairwise disjoint sets with different alleles. The courtiers were taken aback by the problem and tried their best to solve it but to no avail.

The prince, who was already in a bad mood, became even more frustrated and ordered them to solve the problem using the binomial axiom and an exhaustive search. The courtiers were now completely befuddled and exhausted. They had no idea how to proceed and begged the prince for mercy.

However, the prince was in no mood to show mercy and continued to insist that they solve the problem. After much cajoling, the courtiers finally managed to solve the problem and the prince was satisfied. However, their solution was not perfect and had a few defects.

The prince, who was known for his abstinence, refused to accept the solution and demanded that they find a perfect solution. The courtiers, who were already exhausted, had no choice but to try again. After a long and tedious search, they finally managed to find a perfect solution and the prince was pleased.

The courtiers had finally managed to solve the problem, much to their posterior!

2023 2.27

Once upon a time, there was a philanthropist named Mr. Smith who was also a trendsetter in the world of finance. He had a vast portfolio of investments, and he was always looking for new ways to maximize his returns. One day, he came across a mathematical concept known as bivariate quantile regression, which he found very intuitive and fascinating.

As he studied this concept further, he realized that it could be used to analyze the progression of consecutive data points in his investments. He hired a team of mathematicians to help him develop a model that would allow him to identify trends and patterns in his portfolio using bivariate quantile regression.

To his delight, he discovered that the model was also useful in the field of factorization. He found that he could use it to break down complex data sets into simpler components, which he could then analyze more easily.

However, Mr. Smith’s interest in this new mathematical tool soon drew the attention of others in the finance industry. His competitors began to use similar models to analyze their own portfolios, and soon, the concept of bivariate quantile regression became widely known and used.

As the popularity of this mathematical tool grew, a corollary emerged – a new trend in the world of finance that emphasized the importance of understanding and analyzing data through mathematical models. Mr. Smith was proud to have been a part of this trendsetting movement, but he also felt a vague sense of unease.

He realized that the unintended consequence of this movement was that it made the world of finance more decadent and exclusive. The hobo on the street had no access to these sophisticated mathematical tools, and he was left behind as the wealthy got even richer.

Mr. Smith struggled with this ethical dilemma, but he ultimately decided to continue using bivariate quantile regression in his work. He knew that the linearity and closure of mathematical models could never fully capture the complexity of human life, but he hoped that he could use this tool to make a positive impact on the world.

As he continued to use bivariate quantile regression in his work, Mr. Smith also became more involved in philanthropy. He used his wealth to support organizations that helped those who were less fortunate, hoping to balance out the unintended consequences of his work in finance.

In the end, Mr. Smith found solace in the fact that he was using his knowledge and resources to do good in the world, even if his work in finance had unintended consequences. He knew that there was no easy answer to the ethical questions that his work raised, but he hoped that he could continue to make a positive impact in his own small way.

2023 2.28

As a statistician, Mary was accustomed to dealing with numbers and data. She had a mind that was always curious about patterns and trends, and she loved nothing more than to crunch the numbers and find correlations that others might have missed.

However, Mary had a dilemma on her hands. Her favorite appliance, a halogen lamp that she had been using for years, had finally given up the ghost. She had tried to replace the bulb, but the tungsten filament inside had expired, and there was no way to fix it.

Mary knew that she needed to find a new lamp, but she was concerned about the environmental impact of her choice. She wanted to lessen her carbon footprint, but she also needed a lamp that would provide the right level of light for her work.

As she researched her options, Mary discovered that there were many types of bulbs available, each with their own advantages and disadvantages. She learned about kerosene lamps, which were cheap and easy to use, but not very bright. She read about neon lights, which were colorful and eye-catching, but not suitable for her work.

Finally, Mary discovered a type of bulb called a halogen incandescent. This bulb had many of the same features as her old halogen lamp, but it was more energy-efficient and had a longer lifespan. She also learned about the interchangability of bulbs and how some had a transresistance, while others had a transconductance.

With this newfound knowledge, Mary decided to aggregate all the information she had learned and make a decision. She settled on a halogen incandescent bulb that would provide the light she needed, while also being more environmentally friendly.

As Mary set up her new lamp, she couldn’t help but feel a sense of satisfaction. She had tackled her dilemma, learned a great deal about bulbs, and made a decision that she felt good about. And as she turned on the lamp and watched the light cascade over her work, she knew that she had made the right choice.

2023 3.1

Once upon a time, there was a young woman named Amy who was highly literate and had a passion for language and reading. However, she struggled to find a satisfying job. She had worked as a job-hopper in many companies, but she persevered in her search for better opportunities while also working to improve her skills and attributes.

During her job search, Amy continuously worked to improve her interpersonal skills, learning to articulate her thoughts clearly and confidently in interviews. Her hard work and determination eventually paid off when she landed a job at a publishing house that specialized in historical books. The job required editors to have a deep understanding of history and be proficient in language expression, which Amy possessed from her love of studying history and reading books.

In her new role, Amy was responsible for creating a reminiscent histogram of historical events that were then published in the form of books. She also had to work overtime to meet deadlines and received overtime pay for her efforts. Despite the pressure, Amy found solace in her passion for history and language.

Although she faced some challenges along the way, including saturation in the market and high competition for jobs, Amy remained focused on her goal. She persevered through the difficulties, using phonetic techniques to improve her speaking skills and eye drops to relieve the strain on her eyes from hours of reading and editing.

Albeit the challenges, Amy’s hard work and dedication paid off, and she found success in her career as an editor, thanks to her exceptional literacy and interpersonal skills.

2023 3.2

Once upon a time, there was a young writer named Emily. She had just finished writing her first novel and was eager to get it published. She had researched various publishing houses and knew that her best chance of getting published was to attend a writer’s conference in New York City.

Emily lived in a small town in the Midwest, so getting to New York City was not going to be easy. She started looking for transportation options and decided to take a round-trip train ride. The train would take her straight to the city and would give her plenty of time to work on her curriculum vitae and prepare for her internship.

Emily’s excitement was palpable as she boarded the train. She had never been to New York City before and was eager to explore the city that never sleeps. As the train chugged along, Emily could feel the traction of the locomotive as it pulled the freight behind it. She took a nibble of her sandwich and watched the scenery outside her window, feeling grateful for the opportunity to travel.

As the train approached New York City, Emily’s excitement turned to nerves. She knew that the publishing industry was highly competitive, and she wasn’t sure if she was ready to tackle it. But she also knew that this was her chance to penetrate the industry and make a name for herself.

Emily checked into her hotel and started working on her curriculum vitae. She knew that this was her chance to make a good impression on the publishing houses. She spent hours perfecting her CV, making sure that all of her skills and accomplishments were highlighted.

The next day, Emily attended the writer’s conference. She was amazed at the talent and skill of the other writers, but she also knew that she had something unique to offer. She attended workshops and panels, taking notes and learning as much as she could about the industry.

After the conference, Emily decided to explore the city. She visited museums, art galleries, and parks, soaking in the culture and vibrancy of New York City. She even got to see the Statue of Liberty up close, marveling at its composite structure and the history it represented.

As Emily prepared to leave New York City, she knew that she had gained valuable experience and knowledge. She had not yet secured a publishing deal, but she felt that she had made progress in her pre-dependency. She knew that she still had a long way to go, but she felt a renewed sense of determination and focus.

On the train ride back home, Emily looked out the window and watched the scenery blur past her. She knew that her journey was just beginning and that there would be challenges ahead. But she also knew that she had the skills and knowledge to overcome them. With renewed focus and an asymptotic drive to succeed, Emily felt ready to override any obstacle that stood in her bearing towards achieving her dreams.

2023 3.3

unbaised qurdratic
